lexUnit.name: thump.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hit heavily, especially with the fist or a blunt implement

sentence.text: So he stayed exactly where he was , rigid with nerves and with the back of his neck all prickly , listening as the muffled footsteps died away and yet another door thumped shut .
The outer door thumped shut , and the lock that had been holding back and resisting went home .
Each word was accompanied by a clenched fist thumping on the chair arm .
She felt as if a hard , heavy fist had thumped her in the stomach .
His feet thumped loudly on bare boards .
His foot thumped against something soft in the darkness .
Sandcastling fathers shouted indignantly and children began pelting the dog with wet sand , which thumped against his woolly flanks .
As they found their target their points tightened into a terrible grip as the rest of his body thumped against the front of the cage .
She headed for the door at a dead run , her new arm thumping uselessly against various items of furniture .
As Francis approached , there came a noise to accompany the smell -- solid bodies thumping against the tin walls , then a cacophony of squeals and snorts .
A bird thumped against the front window of the house .
The bullets thumped into the wet blanket in front of me , making it jump like there was a bear inside .
A rumbling filled the air also , as casks of beer were trundled from the depths of the cellar , the barrels thumping on the stones and resounding like the indigestion of Giants .
Endill tried to sit up to get a better look but as he did so , knocked over a book and it thumped onto the shelf .
Lumps of turf thumped down on them and into the fire .
By the time the unmarked police car was thumping down the motorway to London , the sun teetered on the horizon .
` Ugghhh ! " he grunted , and the mug thumped down on the varnished wood .
He was hardly aware of lurching downstairs and into the sharp rain , binoculars thumping his chest .
Suddenly , the pole thumped so hard into an unseen object it almost dislodged Maggie .
Creggan thumped straight into him at speed , the sound of it travelling across the glen .
Rourke 's voice sounded low and even across the silence of the room , and Lissa 's heart began to thump wildly against her ribcage .
After two weeks RSGB 's thick brown-covered report thumped on to Lowe 's desk .
The umbrella struck , thumping his shoulder .
At that moment the door was flung back , thumping against the wall .
Helluva fella ! they shouted as he thumped into the chair beside the student , one hand gripping round her shoulder , the other smearing red drops from lips and chin .
As the coachman rose , a lightning kick thumped into his genitals .
